message:
I have a legacy PHP website that I'd like to upgrade to use modern tools like haml/scss + jammit et al. I'm thinking middleman is perfect as most pages are static with just the occasional PHP snippet in a couple of pages.

I'm thinking that I can have some pages as:

somepath/somefile.php.haml

and others as

somepath/anotherfile.html.haml

and deal with a little ugliness to get the php passed through (perhaps from partials?). I'm not adverse to writing a little extra code to ease the way, but would appreciate any hints on where to focus.

I wonder if anyone else has faced this and has some tips? Thanks in advance!
In the past, I've written a custom Haml "php" filter so I can create a block which is ignored by Haml and wrapped in <?php tags
